result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bret S Naponelli

records.addlTxt: Court modifies no contact order to no violent contact with victim.

Defendant Bret S Naponelli appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Bret S Naponelli.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Bail/Bond Hearing held on victim's motion.  Arguments heard.  Court modifies no contact order to no violent contact with victim.  All other conditions of bail to remain.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bret S Naponelli in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Bret S Naponelli.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Statement SY regarding no contact order.  State objects.  Court will take motion under advisement and will readdress it at next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with SLY (DOB: 03/13/1984)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bret S Naponelli appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David Thomas Conley appeared by video for Bret S Naponelli.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
